description: Borrowed from Spanish macho (“male”), from Latin masculus. Doublet of male.

adjectives.description: macho (comparative more macho, superlative most macho)

entries.meaning: (informal) Tending to display masculine characteristics, such as domineering, fierceness, bravado, etc., in ways that are showily and histrionically tough.
A macho person; a person who tends to display masculine characteristics, such as domineering, fierceness, and bravado.
examples: Synonyms: macho man; see also Thesaurus:hypermasculine man

entries.meaning: The striped mullet of California (Mugil cephalus, syn. Mugil mexicanus).
